page.title: 09NORTH BRENT - FARM
page.content: Harrow School Farm was given by John Lyon in the sixteenth century to sustain his boys public school. It is now 60 acrers with 100 Friesian dairy cows; beef cattle bred by artificial insemination from Charolais stock administered by the Harrow boys; three Pitrain sows with litters; bantams; a small flock of Welsh Black/Jacob sheep and two horses. An Old Harrovian runs the farm with the help of a manager and his wife. The boys from the school help with the labour and rhe wife runs a health food/farm produce shop on thesite. The milk is pasteurised on the premises and supplies the school and The Clementine hurchill Private Hospital which is nearby A rabbi makes milk kosher for his congregation in a separate part of the dairy. There are two Victorian farm cottages and a cluster of stables and barns.
